message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.LG, cs.SE. 

This paper combines Answer Set Programming (ASP) with Dynamic Linear Time Temporal Logic (DLTL) to define a temporal logic programming language for reasoning about complex actions and infinite computations. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) sub-category, as it deals with logic-based reasoning and knowledge representation. Additionally, the paper involves formal methods and verification techniques, which are often associated with the Logic in Computer Science (cs.LO) and Programming Languages (cs.PL) sub-categories. The use of temporal logic and bounded model checking also suggests a connection to the Logic and Verification (cs.LG) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with the application of these techniques to software engineering, which could place it in the Software Engineering (cs.SE) sub-category.
